name: BA's Best Piña Colada
description: The ultimate tropical cocktail, this piña colada recipe blends fresh pineapple with two rums and two types of coconut for the last word on utter refreshment.
ingredients: ½ fresh pineapple, peeled, cut into 1½" pieces
6 oz. sweetened cream of coconut (preferably Coco López; well shaken before measuring)
2 oz. unsweetened coconut milk (well shaken before measuring)
Maraschino cherries and lime wedges (for serving)
instructions: Place ½ fresh pineapple, peeled, cut into 1½" pieces in a resealable plastic bag, laying them flat. Freeze until solid, at least 3 hours. Purée frozen pineapple, 6 oz. sweetened cream of coconut, 2 oz. unsweetened coconut milk, 8 oz. white rum, 1 oz. fresh lime juice, and 3 cups ice in a blender until smooth. Transfer blender jar to freezer; freeze until mixture is thickened (it should be the consistency of a milkshake), 25–35 minutes. Blend again until mixture is the perfect slushy frozen drink consistency. Divide among 4 glasses. Top off each with ½ oz. dark rum (if using) and garnish each with a maraschino cherry and a lime wedge. Do Ahead: Pineapple can be chopped 3 months ahead; keep frozen. Piña colada can stay in freezer up to 4 hours after first blend. Editor’s note: This piña colada cocktail recipe was first printed in February 2016.
